result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelo Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Angelo Hicks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Angelo Hicks was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Angelo Hicks was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations. *****COSTS FROM COUNT 3 ARE TO BE COLLECTED WHILE ON PROBATION ON COUNT 1*****

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. Pay supervision fees. Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. ***OR*** Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation. 
* Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
* If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
* Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. 
*****COST FROM COUNT 3 ARE TO BE PAID WHILE ON PROBATION ON COUNT 1*****
Perform  60    hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization. May not have contact with victims, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: *****COSTS ON COUNT 3 ARE TO BE COLLECTED WHILE ON PROBATION ON COUNT 1*****

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelo Hicks

records.addlTxt: 1:40 PM Defendant Angelo Hicks appeared by video, in rehab.  Attorney Aileen Henry in court for Angelo Hicks.  Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star in court for State of Wisconsin.  Clerk HM.  No objection to DE's appearance by zoom today. State is compliant with victim rights notification. Ct 1 - court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 2 years with conditions, no credit; Ct 3 - court imposes 129 days incarceration with credit for 129 days time served concurrent to 22CF125; costs ordered and to be paid during time on probation; DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to Atty Henry. Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court by zoom and w/ Attorney Henry.  Clerk HMcBride.  On state's motion, ct 2 is dismissed. DE enters guilty plea to cts 1 and 3. Court finds DE guilty.   SEH 10/20 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court by zoom and w/ Attorney Henry by zoom.     Clerk HMcBride.   DE in rehab.  All cases resolved. PLEAH set over to 8/15 9am for Atty Henry to appear in person.  DE by zoom.  Bond continued.
DE's request to appear by zoom for 8/11/22 at 11 am is approved by the Court; Attorney Henry notified by email. Clerk NN contacted DE with the zoom information.
DE's Request to Appear Via Zoom

Original receipt 22R 016736
**added to case 6/15/22 - error on receipting report BL/mg**

$250 deposited on 6/8/22
22R 016736 - from joint services on case 22cf125.
(Note: 22cf225 has $250 cash bond set - with note posted - but receipt appears to be in case 22cf125.6/14/22 bl)

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Henry.   Clerk HMcBride.  DE rejects state's global offer.  21CF1025 set for trial.  JSH 8/11 11am.  JS 8/15 830am.   PTO to be filed.  Bond continued.  Cross-referenced cases trail.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Attorney Aileen Henry in court with Defendant Angelo Hicks who appears in custody.  Clerk: PT
  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over to Br 1.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Angelo Hicks in court, in custody.  Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Henry is ill today and unable to appear today.  Court tolls time for cause and reschedules hearing.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Pick n Save - any stores in Kenosha County

01:42 PM   Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Bub.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on February 25, 2022 at 09:15 am. $250  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
